    • Constructor Detail

      • VNTool

        public VNTool(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gameC,
              org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame stateBG,
              VNSound sound,
              VNSound bg)
        Constructor for VNTool. Will take the GameContainer, StateBasedGame, and VNSound classes from where ever it's called and initialize them.
        Parameters:
        gameC - - Game container object from slick
        stateBG - - State based game object from slick
        sound - - VNSound class for holding etc sounds other than the bg music
        bg - - VNSound class specifically for holding the bg music

        Returns:

      • getStringArg

        public java.lang.String getStringArg(java.lang.String str,
                                     int fromIndex)
        When given a line of VNC code, returns the first string argument within this string, starting the search at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        str - - Line to pull string argument from
        index - - Start the search of the string argument from this index
        Returns:
        First string arugment fround from the input string starting from the "fromIndex"

      • getIntArg

        public int getIntArg(java.lang.String str,
                     int fromIndex)
        When given a line of VNC code, returns the first int argument within this string, starting the search at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        str - - Line of VNC code to pull int argument from
        fromIndex - - Start the search of the string argument from this index
        Returns:
        First int argument from the input line of VNC, starting the search at "fromIndex"

        public void drawString(java.lang.String text,
                       int lineLen,
                       org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g)
        Will display a string to the window, character by character. To reset, make i = 0.
        Parameters:
        text - - Text to display to the window
        lineLen - - How long you want the window to be
        g - - The graphics windows to display the String to
